title: Israel still restricting aid one week ahead of U.S. deadline
Live briefing: Israel ends agreement with U.N. agency for Palestinians
content: Israel said it has withdrawn from the 1967 deal legally recognizing UNRWA. The Knesset has passed legislation curbing the U.N. agency’s activities and privileges.
summary: Israel said it has withdrawn from the 1967 deal legally recognizing UNRWA. The Knesset has passed legislation curbing the U.N. agency’s activities and privileges.

title: Israel investigates alleged document leak to foreign media
As regional violence rages, Saudi Arabia pitches itself as investment hub
Israeli strikes in eastern Lebanon are hitting civilians without warning
content: At least 10 of 14 strikes Friday that caused casualties in the northern Bekaa Valley were outside the Israeli military’s evacuation zone, a Post review found.
summary: At least 10 of 14 strikes Friday that caused casualties in the northern Bekaa Valley were outside the Israeli military’s evacuation zone, a Post review found.

title: Why the U.S. election is so long and others around the world are so short
content: The end of a U.S. election season can feel like the final leg of a marathon. That’s because the U.S. stands out among global democracies for its long campaigns.
summary: The end of a U.S. election season can feel like the final leg of a marathon. That’s because the U.S. stands out among global democracies for its long campaigns.

title: Protesters hurl mud at Spain’s king, queen and prime minister after floods
content: King Felipe, Queen Letizia and Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez were met with anger in Paiporta, a town badly hit by the devastating floods in Valencia.
summary: King Felipe, Queen Letizia and Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez were met with anger in Paiporta, a town badly hit by the devastating floods in Valencia.

title: Pro-E.U. candidate wins Moldova runoff despite fears of Russian interference
content: Maia Sandu led with 55.41 percent against Alexandr Stoianoglo, a former prosecutor general backed by the pro-Russian Party of Socialists.
summary: Maia Sandu led with 55.41 percent against Alexandr Stoianoglo, a former prosecutor general backed by the pro-Russian Party of Socialists.

title: Israel withdraws from 1967 deal that recognizes UNRWA; agency says it is in the dark
Meet the Russian blogger accused of U.S. election interference
content: Blogs and programs like Mikhail Zvinchuk’s Rybar represent a transformation of Russia’s information sphere amid dissatisfaction with empty state media reports.
summary: Blogs and programs like Mikhail Zvinchuk’s Rybar represent a transformation of Russia’s information sphere amid dissatisfaction with empty state media reports.

title: Israeli forces used civilians as human shields in Gaza, Palestinians and soldiers say
Where Trump and Harris stand on global issues ahead of the U.S. election
content: The new president will face a host of foreign policy challenges including immigration, climate change and wars in Ukraine and the Middle East.
summary: The new president will face a host of foreign policy challenges including immigration, climate change and wars in Ukraine and the Middle East.

title: As U.S. election nears, ‘fascism’ is in the spotlight again
content: Though former members of his administration have called Trump a fascist, his political prospects have not dimmed. What does that tell us about the term’s power and usefulness?
summary: Though former members of his administration have called Trump a fascist, his political prospects have not dimmed. What does that tell us about the term’s power and usefulness?

title: As regional violence rages, Saudi Arabia pitches itself as investment hub
content: The summit in Riyadh, known as the Future Investment Initiative, allowed the kingdom to showcase its ambitious plans to reshape its economy.
summary: The summit in Riyadh, known as the Future Investment Initiative, allowed the kingdom to showcase its ambitious plans to reshape its economy.

title: Hundreds showed up for a Halloween parade. They got ‘ghosted.’
content: MySpiritHalloween, the website that promoted a Halloween parade in Dublin that never existed, says it is “ashamed” and blamed human error.
summary: MySpiritHalloween, the website that promoted a Halloween parade in Dublin that never existed, says it is “ashamed” and blamed human error.

title: Entire northern Gaza population ‘at imminent risk’ of death, UNICEF head says
content: The World Health Organization reported an attack on a Gaza City clinic where polio vaccination was taking place. Israel denied striking in the area at that time.
summary: The World Health Organization reported an attack on a Gaza City clinic where polio vaccination was taking place. Israel denied striking in the area at that time.

title: Israeli forces used civilians as human shields in Gaza, Palestinians and soldiers say
content: Palestinians describe being forced to carry out life-threatening tasks by Israeli forces in Gaza.
summary: Palestinians describe being forced to carry out life-threatening tasks by Israeli forces in Gaza.

title: 58,000 children vaccinated against polio in north Gaza amid reported strikes
Israeli forces capture man in northern Lebanon, officials say
Arab states resist U.S. pressure to denounce Houthis
content: Attacks in the Red Sea by Yemen’s Houthis are hurting economies across the Middle East, but Arab leaders are loath to be seen siding with the U.S. and Israel.
summary: Attacks in the Red Sea by Yemen’s Houthis are hurting economies across the Middle East, but Arab leaders are loath to be seen siding with the U.S. and Israel.

title: The new season of ‘The Bachelor’ in Ukraine shows the scars of war
content: The man has an easy smile, the women are gorgeously dressed, and generators fend off the blackouts with air raid shelters nearby.
summary: The man has an easy smile, the women are gorgeously dressed, and generators fend off the blackouts with air raid shelters nearby.

title: Israelis and Palestinians find little hope in divisive U.S. election
Israelis and Palestinians find little hope in divisive U.S. election
content: In a region upended by a year of violence and tumult, many are looking ahead to the vote between Trump and Harris on Tuesday with a sense of resignation.
summary: In a region upended by a year of violence and tumult, many are looking ahead to the vote between Trump and Harris on Tuesday with a sense of resignation.

title: Russia feigns indifference over U.S. election but roots quietly for Trump
content: Trump’s international agenda is more to the Kremlin’s tastes but even his plans for ending the war in Ukraine might not be acceptable to Putin.
summary: Trump’s international agenda is more to the Kremlin’s tastes but even his plans for ending the war in Ukraine might not be acceptable to Putin.

title: Iran’s Khamenei warns of ‘crushing’ response to Israeli strikes
Iran’s Khamenei warns of ‘crushing’ response to Israeli strikes
content: Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei did not explicitly say an attack would originate from Iran, adding to speculation Tehran plans to retaliate from neighboring Iraq.
summary: Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei did not explicitly say an attack would originate from Iran, adding to speculation Tehran plans to retaliate from neighboring Iraq.

title: Polio vaccinations resume in Gaza City amid ‘near-impossible conditions’
Iran’s supreme leader pledges ‘crushing response’; Pentagon bolsters Middle East presence
content: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei pledged a “crushing response” to Israel and the U.S., as the Pentagon said it is sending U.S. ballistic missile defense destroyers and aircraft to the Middle East.
summary: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei pledged a “crushing response” to Israel and the U.S., as the Pentagon said it is sending U.S. ballistic missile defense destroyers and aircraft to the Middle East.
